tourBios.curYearHigh: Finished T10 at the PGA Professional National Championship.
tourBios.otherInfo:
2008: Made the cut in nine of 22 starts during his rookie season on the PGA TOUR. Lone top-10 was T9 at the Wyndham Championship. Also made six starts on the Web.com Tour, with a T35 at the Fort Smith Classic his only cut made. Earned his PGA TOUR card after a T23 at the 2007 Qualifying Tournament. The teaching pro at New Albany (Ohio) CC earned his card, thanks to a final-round 68, which helped him move up from a T42 position entering the last round. 

2005: Had a T65 at the FUNAI Classic at the Walt Disney World Resort. Played in seven TOUR events. 

2004: Made his foiurth PGA Championship appearance while serving as an assistant pro at Wedgewood G&CC in Powell, Ohio. PGA Club Professional Player of the Year from 2003-2005. Won the PGA Club Championship at Longaberger GC in Nashport, Ohio, 40 miles east of his home in Columbus. 

2003: Had a T3 at the 2003 PGA Club Championship...Finished T82 at the PGA TOUR Qualifying Tournament. 

1998: Member of the Web.com Tour, when he made the cut in half of his 28 starts with four top-25 finishes. Best showing came at the season-opening Lakeland Classic where he T12. 

1997: Was T93 at the PGA TOUR Qualifying Tournament.

Amateur: Was an NAIA All-American at Glenville State in West Virginia.

tourBios.otherVics: (1): 2002 Ohio Open. 2004 Ohio Open, PGA Professional National Championship. 2005 PGA Stroke Play Championship. 2006 PGA Match Play Championship, PGA Stroke Play Championship. 2010 Ohio Open. 2012 PGA Match Play Championship. 2013 PGA Match Play Championship, PGA Stroke Play Championship. 2014 PGA Stroke Play Championship.
tourBios.curYearHigh: Finished T10 at the PGA Professional National Championship.
tourBios.carHigh:
2014: Named PGA Professional of the Year for a fourth time but first since 2005...Was T5 at the PGA Professional National Championship...Won the PGA Stroke Play Championship.

2013: Finished eighth at the PGA Professional National Championship...Captured the PGA Stroke Play Championship title.

2012: Finished 12th at the PGA Professional National Championship.

2008: Made the cut in nine of 22 starts during his rookie season on the PGA TOUR. Lone top-10 was T9 at the Wyndham Championship. Also made six starts on the Web.com Tour, with a T35 at the Fort Smith Classic his only cut made. Earned his PGA TOUR card after a T23 at the 2007 Qualifying Tournament. The teaching pro at New Albany (Ohio) CC earned his card, thanks to a final-round 68, which helped him move up from a T42 position entering the last round. 

2005: Earned PGA Professional of the Year honors for a third consecutive year...Had a T65 at the FUNAI Classic at the Walt Disney World Resort. Played in seven TOUR events. 

2004: Repeated as PGA Professional of the Year...Made his fourth PGA Championship appearance while serving as an assistant pro at Wedgewood G&CC in Powell, Ohio. PGA Club Professional Player of the Year from 2003-2005. Won the PGA Club Championship at Longaberger GC in Nashport, Ohio, 40 miles east of his home in Columbus. 

2003: Named PGA Professional of the Year for the first time...Had a T3 at the PGA Club Championship...Finished T82 at the PGA TOUR Qualifying Tournament. 

1998: Member of the Web.com Tour, when he made the cut in half of his 28 starts with four top-25 finishes. Best showing came at the season-opening Lakeland Classic where he T12. 

1997: Was T93 at the PGA TOUR Qualifying Tournament.

Amateur: Was an NAIA All-American at Glenville State in West Virginia.
tourBios.personal: Teaching professional at New Albany CC in New Albany, Ohio...Has recorded five holes-in-one, including four in competition.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the PGA TOUR was T9th in 2008 at the Wyndham Championship.
